text: Thomas Daniel Weiskopf (November 9, 1942 â€“ August 20, 2022) was an American professional golfer. He played on the PGA Tour and the Champions Tour. He was more active during the 1970s. He won 16 PGA Tour titles between 1968 and 1982. After his golfing career, he became a golf course architect. Weiskopf was born in Massillon, Ohio. Weiskopf died on August 20, 2022 in Big Sky, Montana from pancreatic cancer at the age of 79. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American golfers Category:Sportspeople from Ohio Category:People from Massillon, Ohio Category:American architects
title: Tom Weiskopf
